perturbation.original_text:
TERM:
The term (the "Term") shall commence on November 1, 2007 and end on October 31, 2008 (unless terminated earlier in accordance with the General Provisions).
perturbation.changed_text:
TERM:
The term (the "Term") shall commence on November 1, 2007 and continue indefinitely.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the end date and stating the term continues 'indefinitely,' it contradicts Section 2 of the General Provisions which states 'The Term shall commence and end on the dates set forth in the Agreement Summary, unless terminated earlier in accordance with this Agreement'. The Agreement Summary no longer specifies an end date.

perturbation.original_text:
Sponsor shall pay $*** to SDBF pursuant to the following:
$ *** due on or before April 30, 2008     $ *** due on or before June 30, 2008     $ *** due on or before August 31, 2008
perturbation.changed_text: Sponsor shall pay amounts as mutually agreed upon by both parties to SDBF.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specifics of 'Annual Payment' and stating that the sponsor will pay the 'amounts as mutually agreed upon by both parties to SDBF,' it contradicts the 3. Payments, stating that 'In consideration of the Sponsorship Benefits to be furnished by SDBF to Sponsor hereunder, Sponsor shall pay to SDBF the Annual Payments set forth in the Agreement Summary on the dates set forth therein'.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding colloquial descriptions of Sponsor as a "partner," nothing herein shall be construed as establishing a legal partnership, joint venture or agency relationship between SDBF and Sponsor or between Padres L.P. (the "Padres") and Sponsor or establishing a joint venture or agency relationship between the parties.
perturbation.changed_text: Sponsor and SDBF shall operate as partners.
perturbation.explanation: By replacing the section which claims that nothing in the agreement shall be construed as establishing a legal partnership with 'Sponsor and SDBF shall operate as partners,' this change is in direct contradiction with Section 13. No Legal Partnership of the General Provisions section.
